main event: On February 22, 1953, observers reported a boomerang-shaped object glowing with an intensely bright light over Lake Pepin, Wisconsin.
interesting points: The object was observed making sharp turns and then shot straight up into the sky with a thump and a vapor cloud., The observer compared the size of the object to a baseball., The sighting lasted for approximately 2 hours., The investigation indicated potential witnesses from a local Astronomy Club., The weather conditions were reported as clear with a quarter moon present.
witness description: local civilians, one a member of the Astronomy Club
